alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 715 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vernon, or near Brattleboro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Brattleboro, Vernon, Guilford Center, Guilford, Marlboro, Halifax, Jacksonville, North Vernon, Whitneyville, West Dummerston, Fairview Village, Grove, Harrisville, Four Corners, West Brattleboro, Packer Corner, West Guilford, Green River, Naulahka and Raponda Turn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
